meanings.def: the process of caring for somebody/something and providing what they need for their health or protection
examples: Some people were badly injured and needed medical care.
We aim to continually improve the quality of patient care.
How much do men share housework and the care of the children?
care for somebody/something to provide care for the elderly
with care With proper care, the plants may last for fifty years.
skin/hair care products
She's still very frail and will need lots of tender loving care.
The couple relied on informal care from relatives.
We have improved the way doctors deliver care.

meanings.def: the fact of providing a home in an institution run by the local authority or with another family for children who cannot live with their parents
examples: in care Most children in care live with foster carers.
The two girls were taken into care after their parents were killed.
He had been in foster care since he was five.
Mentors support teenagers leaving care.

meanings.def: attention or thought that you give to something that you are doing so that you will do it well and avoid mistakes or damage
examples: Great care is needed when choosing a used car.
with care She chose her words with care.
Fragile—handle with care (= written on a container holding something that is easily broken or damaged)
Consumers must exercise care when buying medicines online.
The little girl was writing her name with painstaking care.
She was charged with driving without due care and attention.
Transporting the specimens requires great care.
She chose her words with care.
The utmost caution must be exercised when handling explosives.
As a matter of prudence, keep a record of all your financial transactions.

meanings.def: a feeling of worry; something that causes problems or worries
examples: I felt free from the cares of the day as soon as I left the building.
Sam looked as if he didn't have a care in the world.

meanings.def: used when writing to somebody at another person’s address
examples: Write to him care of his lawyer.

meanings.def: being cared for by somebody
examples: The child was left in the care of friends.
You won’t come to any harm while you’re in their care.
Many historic sites are in the care of the National Trust.

meanings.def: used when saying goodbye
examples: Bye! Take care!

meanings.def: to be careful
examples: Take care (that) you don’t drink too much!
Care should be taken to close the lid securely.

meanings.def: to care for somebody/something/yourself; to be careful about something
examples: Who's taking care of the children while you're away?
She takes great care of her clothes.
He's old enough to take care of himself.
You should take better care of yourself.
We’ve asked my mother to take care of/​look after the kids while we’re away.
You can borrow my camera if you promise to take care of/​look after it.
She does some voluntary work, caring for the elderly
I don’t really care for spicy food.

meanings.def: to be responsible for or to deal with a situation or task
examples: Don't worry about the travel arrangements. They're all being taken care of.
Celia takes care of the marketing side of things.

meanings.def: receiving medical care from somebody
examples: He's under the care of Dr Parks.
refugees under the care of the relief agencies

meanings.def: to feel that something is important and worth worrying about
examples: I don't care (= I will not be upset) if I never see him again!
He threatened to fire me, as if I cared!
care about something She cares deeply about environmental issues.
I don't really care about how much it costs.
care what, whether, etc… I don't care what he thinks.
care that… She doesn't seem to care that he's been married four times before.
He hardly cares what he does any more.
I don't know which she chose, nor do I greatly care.
No one actually cared what I thought.
The information is there for anyone who cares enough to find it.
I don't care what he thinks!

meanings.def: to like or love somebody and worry about what happens to them
examples: He genuinely cares about his employees.
They care an awful lot about each other.
It is good to know that there is someone who cares.

meanings.def: to make the effort to do something
examples: I've done this job more times than I care to remember.

meanings.def: used to say that a person is no longer worried about or interested in somebody/something
examples: I'm past caring what he does.

meanings.def: used to say, often rudely, that you do not think that somebody/something is important or worth worrying about
examples: Quite honestly, I couldn't care less what they do.

meanings.def: used to say that a person is not worried about or interested in what happens to somebody/something
examples: I could be dead for all he cares!

meanings.def: to not care at all about somebody/something
not to care at all about something; to think that something is not important
not to care at all
examples: I don’t care two hoots about having money, as long as I’m happy.

meanings.def: to think that somebody/something is not important or that they have no value
used to say, often rudely, that you do not think that something is important or interesting
examples: Who cares what she thinks?

meanings.def: used to ask somebody politely if they would like something or would like to do something, or if they would be willing to do something
examples: Would you care for another drink?
If you'd care to follow me, I'll show you where his office is.
Would you like a cup of coffee?
We’re going to a club tonight. Do you want to come with us?

meanings.def: a private US charity. It was established as the Cooperative for American Remittances to Europe in 1945, to help people in Europe after the Second World War by sending CARE packages of food and other items. Today these are sent to refugees (= people forced from their homes by war or other events) and people who have survived natural disasters. The phrase CARE package is sometimes also used in a humorous way to mean a package of items sent by US parents to children who are away from home.
